title: Will you guys ever take the firewall issue seriously?
body:
I'm being 100% honest, and serious about this comment. I'm not trolling, I'm sincerely asking if you guys (Riot) will ever take the "can't connect due to firewall" issue seriously, so that the many people affected by this can play? 

I was fortunate enough to suddenly be able to join games thanks to WTFast, but suddenly two days ago even that quick on me, and ever since then I have been unable to join ranked and normal games. Bot games work fine, for some reason.
I'm tired of searching for solutions.
I'm tired of doing thousands of useless tests for you guys.
I'm tired of reading about how everyone has this massive issue and you guys refuse to do anything about it.
Either refund me for the money I have spent, or help us with this issue. Oh, and maybe pardon us from the Leave Buster. Perhaps you could change the prompt message to

"We are sorry that you can't play and that is why you afk'd" msg, to which we can only answer "You don't care"

Either help us out, or just flat out tell us to stop caring and go play another game. THIS IS an issue on your end.

I've been having this problem since the Zyra patch. It's never been "solved." I've pretty much chalked it up to my router just being incompatible with Riot's method of connecting after champion select. I've gone through a couple computers since then, and a few different software and firewall configurations. I've completely disabled and uninstalled my firewall, as well as the Windows one (well, not uninstalled, but poked around in the registry and whatnot.) I've port-forwarded and messed with settings until the cows came home. There's clearly nothing I can do when any friend I have come over, experiences the same issue over my network. I've contacted my ISP several times and they never know what to do. 

One key factor I've mentioned on my dozens and dozens of forum responses (I respond whenever I see this mentioned) is that I DON'T HAVE THE ISSUE THE FIRST GAME OF EVERY MAP TYPE AFTER A PATCH. It connects without fail. Second game on SR, HA, what have you, I'm pressing "reconnect" over and over. 

However, I no longer live with this issue. I've found a workaround that doesn't make sense considering it STILL doesn't connect properly without a firewall. BUT, I use my Firewall software to circumvent the issue. I use AVG. What I do is set it to "interactive mode," which prompts me to give permission to each new program to allow or disallow it through the firewall. If I manually allow it each time, and don't prompt it to save the rule, I can connect immediately after the prompt. 

I really recommend you try a similar feature on your firewall and see if it works for you. Even though it makes no sense to me, you'd think some wise techie at Riot (is that an oxymoron?) would be able to at least gain some insight into what causes the issue, based on A. my solution, and B. the unique factor of it only connecting immediately after a patch.

On a basic, idiot level, it leads me to believe that something about the application being "new" is okay with my router. But after he's already seen it once, he doesn't want to let it through again. Why????

Perhaps they've given up because there are so many unique situations under which this occurs, but I'm using the old Westell A90-7500 whatever-whatever that has cropped up numerous times in discussion of this issue. I'm willing to bet that if you have the same router, this is happening for the same reasons and my "solution" will work for you.

Again. Try this it helped
Press Windows+R
Type services.msc and hit enter
Scroll down and find Windows Firewall in the list
Right-Click on "Windows Firewall" and select "Properties"
Change "Startup type" to "Disabled"
Hit "Ok"
Do the same for the "Windows Defender" Service
Reboot your machine

I had this problem about a year ago. Trust me when I say this COMPLETELY worked for me and will work for you if we have the same problem. 

- Press Windows+R
- Type services.msc and hit enter
- Scroll down and find Windows Firewall in the list
- Right-Click on "Windows Firewall" and select "Properties"
- Change "Startup type" to "Disabled"
- Hit "Ok"
- Do the same for the "Windows Defender" Service
- Reboot your machine

You might have to do this every now and again like if you switch internets or a big update happens in your computer

If it works for you add me. I wanna know you can play happily again
